IShader

Defines the public interface for using CShader

Functions

Returns

BeginRender
virtual void BeginRender(
IGraphics *pGraphics,
IRenderMaterial *pFrontMaterial,
IRenderMaterial *pBackMaterial,
std::vector<CRefObj<IPointLight>> &lights,
DirectX::XMMATRIX *pWorld
) = 0

Starts rendering.

Parameters

IGraphics*

graphics device

material to use for front faces

pBackMaterial

list of lights to use

pWorld
DirectX::XMMATRIX*

matrix to apply

EndRender
virtual void EndRender(
IGraphics *pGraphics
) = 0

SetThreadCounts
virtual void SetThreadCounts(
int xThreads,
int yThreads,
int zThreads
) = 0

This is a bit of a hack. We need some way to specify how many threads to execute for the compute shader. This needs to be rethought (maybe make specific class for shader with underlying compute shader??)

Parameters
xThreads
int

Number of threads in X axis

yThreads
int

Number of threads in Y axis

zThreads
int

Number of threads in Z axis
